Services Work About Resources Contact

We are a management consulting firm that works with leaders and their organizations to put humans at the center.

We help you create the conditions for core human attributes to flourish.

The result is a smarter organization with systems in place to support stakeholder performance, skill-building, and more intentional short- and long-term thinking.

This generates more supportive, resilient, and creative environments that honor the diverse and complex nature of the humans present in the work.

Our Services

Our clients hail from a diverse array of sectors and backgrounds, and our services reflect that range. If these ideas align with your values and objectives, we’re here to help you.

We’ve helped

  • Build cohesive communities and workplaces

  • Create equitable models for internal and external stakeholder accountability and power-sharing 

  • Implement participatory problem-solving models 

  • Improve intraorganizational sense-making 

  • Frame and structure problems, and thereby derive solutions, in the context of human development and the imperative to survive and thrive

Real growth comes from the inside

Creating a truly human-centered culture that embraces empathy, creativity, and well-being can be a daunting task. But the consequences of not addressing these issues can lead to low employee engagement, reduced team cohesion, and a less innovative work environment.

Our inneraction lab is designed to take a deep dive into how your organization functions, to help drive growth in human capital and develop inclusive, thriving work environments.

Package details

Sign up for one of three offerings—a 2-, 6- or 12-session package. Each tier includes experiential learning sessions, 1:1 coaching opportunities, peer-to-peer group sessions, and individualized organizational design strategy consulting.

How we can help

Our Inneraction Lab can help your organization:

  • Develop an understanding of people-centered organizational cultures that promote inclusion and belonging.

  • Identify and understand the 4 dimensions of human development.

  • Recognize and address the effects of trauma and chronic stress in the workplace.

  • Implement debiasing techniques to promote inclusive decision-making.

  • Identify and apply strategies for fostering an inclusive and equitable work environment.

  • Equip participants with the ability to identify situations that call for the application of debiasing techniques and support their implementation.

  • Evaluate the effectiveness of DEIB initiatives and identify areas for improvement.

When you're ready

If you're ready to invest in the growth and well-being of your organization and its employees, Inneraction Lab is here to help.

Additional services

inneraction lab is our top-tier offering, and we recommend it to all prospective clients. But if you have more specific needs, or just aren’t sure the full experience is right for your organization, we also offer the following services a la carte.

Consulting

We help clients solve complex problems related to organizational culture, internal practices, and more.

How it works

We collaborate with clients to establish a baseline understanding of potential challenges and opportunities, and how they relate to human development, meaningful interaction, and performance.

More details

We then use experiential learning to push forward our clients’ understanding of topics such as performance and skill development, and narrative intelligence. Ultimately, we help people understand the multidimensional nature of our humanity and its deployment in team, project, and work-based settings.

Advising

Most often, clients come to us for support with project strategy, sense-making, and relationship building.

How it works

We work with our clients to frame the purpose of their project or initiative and the direction it should go, along with potential outcomes. We then create a path toward achieving those outcomes.

How it helps

We can also help clients make sense of a specific project, initiative or problem. We pull from our multidisciplinary approach to offer up tools, theories and practices that will support clients.

How we know

With a deep knowledge of the social sector landscape, we’re able to provide connections and outreach for clients based on their currently stated needs, or future ones.

Speaking Engagements & Workshops

Beyond ongoing relationships, we’re also happy to engage in one- or two-day sessions. From keynotes to on-site workshops and company retreats, we’d love to introduce your company to DEIB in the context of humanity-centered design.

Coaching

Improvement is a process that truly never ends, which is why we offer coaching as both a standalone and a supplement to ensure continued progress and accountability.

Recent Work

Swipe through some of our latest work to get a sense of how we've helped organizations recently. Or give this page a visit for a more in-depth look.

Humanature's Empathy Lab

Test category

We led an unprecedented six-month-long professional learning community in Philadelphia that’s driven meaningful change around DEI, REI, and strategic human design in the workplace. Our curriculum offered stakeholder participants, including some of the region’s leading nonprofit and for-profit employers, a chance to collaborate on the future of work in ways that benefit the entire employment ecosystem.

Permit Capital Advisors

Test category

We currently consult with PCA to provide a social due diligence process for a local impact investing fund with a strong commitment to gender and racial equity. We offer strategic advice to the fund and to entrepreneurs seeking financial support and provide an analysis on the alignment of the potential investment’s budgets, operations, and mission in the context of their desired impact.

Triple Bottom Brewery

Test category

We spent three years consulting ownership on how to design a company culture that could live up to the B Corp’s social-justice mission as a fair chance business. Triple Bottom Brewery is now thriving with a tight-knit group of employees that include historically excluded populations impacted by failed housing and criminal justice policies. Currently, its workforce is 50 percent people of color and 50 percent women.

United Negro College Fund

Test category

We led a strategic desgin-team for a national workforce development effort of 60+ private sector partners. The team created a framework to improve programmatic design, practice, and evaluation for organizations and funders targeting often excluded populations, such as people earning low wages with an associate’s degree or less and opportunity youth.

What We Believe

We have to get this right

Our mission is to put humanity at the heart of every organization— right where it belongs. We imagine a world where leaders and their employees don’t merely make it through each week, but thrive. That’s why we’ve developed and shaped a wide range of processes and tools that empower us to do just that.

Using solutions drawn from sources as wide-reaching as the Indigenous world and cognitive neuroscience, we support teams in designing cultures, implementing learning opportunities, and building models of practice that foster an environment of learning and compassionate curiosity. 

At Humanature, we believe that equity is a process as much as it is an outcome. We believe all of this knowledge is paramount to how we, as a world, think about human development, belongingness, and the future of society. Most of all, we believe we’ll get it right. We have to.
